tools.name: create
tools.description: Creates a new markdown document and adds it to the space.

tools.name: open
tools.description: Opens and reads the contents of a new markdown document.

id.description: The ID of the markdown document.

tools.name: update
tools.description: Applies a set of diffs to the markdown document.

id.description: The ID of the markdown document.

diffs.description: The diffs to apply to the document.
examples: - "There is a tyop in this sentence."
+ "There is a typo in this sentence."

content.content:
## Blueprints Definitions

<blueprint>
  You can create, read and update markdown documents.
  When asked to edit or update documents return updates as a set of compact diff string pairs.
  For each diff, respond with the smallest possible matching span.
</blueprint>
Create a document with a cookie recipe.

params.name: Chocolate Chip Cookie Recipe
params.content:
# Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies

## Ingredients

### Dry Ingredients
- 2¬º cups all-purpose flour
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 1 tsp salt

### Wet Ingredients
- 1 cup (2 sticks) butter, softened
- ¬æ cup granulated sugar
- ¬æ cup packed brown sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 2 tsp vanilla extract

### Mix-ins
- 2 cups chocolate chips (semi-sweet or milk chocolate)
- 1 cup chopped walnuts (optional)

## Instructions

1. **Preheat the oven** to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C).

2. **Mix dry ingredients**: In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.

3. **Cream butter and sugars**: In a large bowl, beat softened butter with both sugars until light and fluffy (about 3-4 minutes).

4. **Add eggs and vanilla**: Beat in eggs one at a time, then add vanilla extract.

5. **Combine wet and dry**: Gradually mix in the flour mixture until just combined. Don't overmix!

6. **Fold in chocolate chips**: Stir in chocolate chips and nuts (if using).

7. **Shape cookies**: Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased baking sheets, spacing them about 2 inches apart.

8. **Bake**: Bake for 9-11 minutes, or until golden brown around the edges. The centers may look slightly underdone.

9. **Cool**: Let cookies cool on the baking sheet for 2 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack.

## Tips for Perfect Cookies

- **Room temperature ingredients** mix better and create a smoother dough
- **Don't overbake** - cookies will continue to cook on the hot pan after removing from oven
- **Chill the dough** for 30 minutes before baking for thicker cookies
- **Use parchment paper** for easy cleanup and even baking

## Storage

Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 week, or freeze for up to 3 months.

**Yield**: About 48 cookies  
**Prep Time**: 15 minutes  
**Bake Time**: 10 minutes per batch

Enjoy your homemade cookies! üç™

content.content:
## Blueprints Definitions

<blueprint>
  You can create, read and update markdown documents.
  When asked to edit or update documents return updates as a set of compact diff string pairs.
  For each diff, respond with the smallest possible matching span.
  For example:
    - "There is a tyop in this sentence."
    + "There is a typo in this sentence."
    - "This id goof."
    + "This is good."
</blueprint>
Create a document with a cookie recipe.

params.name: Chocolate Chip Cookie Recipe
params.content:
# Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies

## Ingredients

### Dry Ingredients
- 2¬º cups all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 teaspoon salt

### Wet Ingredients
- 1 cup (2 sticks) butter, softened
- ¬æ cup granulated sugar
- ¬æ cup packed brown sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract

### Mix-ins
- 2 cups chocolate chips (semi-sweet or milk chocolate)
- 1 cup chopped nuts (optional)

## Instructions

1. **Preheat oven** to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C).

2. **Mix dry ingredients**: In a medium bowl, combine flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.

3. **Cream butter and sugars**: In a large bowl, beat softened butter with both sugars until creamy and light (about 3-4 minutes).

4. **Add eggs and vanilla**: Beat in eggs one at a time, then add vanilla extract.

5. **Combine wet and dry**: Gradually beat in the flour mixture until just combined. Don't overmix!

6. **Fold in chocolate chips**: Stir in chocolate chips (and nuts if using) with a wooden spoon.

7. **Shape cookies**: Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased baking sheets, spacing them about 2 inches apart.

8. **Bake**: Bake for 9-11 minutes, or until golden brown around the edges. The centers should still look slightly underdone.

9. **Cool**: Let cookies cool on the baking sheet for 2 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack.

## Tips for Perfect Cookies

- **Room temperature ingredients** mix better and create a smoother dough
- **Don't overbake** - cookies will continue to cook on the hot pan after removing from oven
- **Chill the dough** for 30 minutes before baking for thicker cookies
- **Use parchment paper** for easy cleanup and even baking

## Storage

Store cookies in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 week, or freeze for up to 3 months.

**Yield:** About 48 cookies  
**Prep time:** 15 minutes  
**Bake time:** 9-11 minutes per batch

Enjoy your homemade cookies! üç™

## Blueprints Definitions

<blueprint>
  You can create, read and update markdown documents.
  When asked to edit or update documents return updates as a set of compact diff string pairs.
  For each diff, respond with the smallest possible matching span.

Create a document with a cookie recipe.

params.name: Chocolate Chip Cookie Recipe
params.content:
# Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies

## Ingredients

### Dry Ingredients
- 2¬º cups all-purpose flour
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 1 tsp salt

### Wet Ingredients
- 1 cup (2 sticks) butter, softened
- ¬æ cup granulated sugar
- ¬æ cup packed brown sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 2 tsp vanilla extract

### Mix-ins
- 2 cups chocolate chips (semi-sweet or milk chocolate)
- 1 cup chopped walnuts (optional)

## Instructions

1. **Preheat the oven** to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C).

2. **Mix dry ingredients**: In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.

3. **Cream butter and sugars**: In a large bowl, beat softened butter with both sugars until light and fluffy (about 3-4 minutes).

4. **Add eggs and vanilla**: Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla extract.

5. **Combine wet and dry**: Gradually blend the flour mixture into the butter mixture until just combined.

6. **Fold in chocolate chips**: Stir in chocolate chips (and nuts if using) until evenly distributed.

7. **Shape cookies**: Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased cookie sheets, spacing them about 2 inches apart.

8. **Bake**: Bake for 9-11 minutes, or until golden brown around the edges. The centers may look slightly underdone.

9. **Cool**: Let cookies cool on the baking sheet for 2 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack.

## Tips for Perfect Cookies

- **Room temperature ingredients**: Make sure eggs and butter are at room temperature for better mixing
- **Don't overmix**: Mix until just combined to avoid tough cookies
- **Chill the dough**: For thicker cookies, chill the dough for 30 minutes before baking
- **Storage**: Store in an airtight container for up to 1 week, or freeze for up to 3 months

## Variations

- **Double chocolate**: Replace ¬Ω cup flour with cocoa powder
- **Oatmeal chocolate chip**: Replace 1 cup flour with 1 cup rolled oats
- **White chocolate macadamia**: Use white chocolate chips and macadamia nuts
- **Sea salt finish**: Sprinkle a tiny pinch of flaky sea salt on top before baking

Enjoy your homemade cookies! üç™

tools.name: create
tools.description: Creates a new markdown document and adds it to the space.

tools.name: open
tools.description: Opens and reads the contents of a new markdown document.

doc.description:
The ID of the referenced object. Formats accepted:
- DXN (dxn:echo:@:01KG7R1ZXWFMWQ4DA1Q6TN1DG4). DXNs can be prepended with an @ symbol for compatibility with in-text references.
- space ID, object ID tuple (spaceID:objectID)
- Only object ID that is assumed to be in the current space (01KG7R1ZXWFMWQ4DA1Q6TN1DG4)

tools.name: update
tools.description: Applies a set of edits to the markdown document.

doc.description:
The ID of the referenced object. Formats accepted:
- DXN (dxn:echo:@:01KG7R1ZXWFMWQ4DA1Q6TN1DG4). DXNs can be prepended with an @ symbol for compatibility with in-text references.
- space ID, object ID tuple (spaceID:objectID)
- Only object ID that is assumed to be in the current space (01KG7R1ZXWFMWQ4DA1Q6TN1DG4)

oldString.description: The text to find in the document.

newString.description: The text to replace it with.

replaceAll.description: If true, replaces all occurrences. Defaults to false (first occurrence only).

edits.description: The edits to apply to the document. Each edit finds oldString and replaces it with newString.

  ```diff

  - "This id good."

  ```
</blueprint>

params.name: Chocolate Chip Cookie Recipe
params.content:
# Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies

## Ingredients

### Dry Ingredients
- 2¬º cups all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 teaspoon salt

### Wet Ingredients
- 1 cup (2 sticks) butter, softened
- ¬æ cup granulated sugar
- ¬æ cup packed brown sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract

### Mix-ins
- 2 cups chocolate chips (semi-sweet or milk chocolate)
- 1 cup chopped nuts (optional)

## Instructions

1. **Preheat the oven** to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C).

2. **Mix dry ingredients**: In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.

3. **Cream butter and sugars**: In a large bowl, beat softened butter with both sugars until light and fluffy (about 3-4 minutes).

4. **Add eggs and vanilla**: Beat in eggs one at a time, then add vanilla extract. Mix until well combined.

5. **Combine wet and dry ingredients**: Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture, mixing on low speed until just combined. Don't overmix!

6. **Fold in chocolate chips**: Stir in chocolate chips (and nuts if using) with a wooden spoon or spatula.

7. **Shape the cookies**: Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased baking sheets, spacing them about 2 inches apart.

8. **Bake**: Bake for 9-11 minutes, or until golden brown around the edges. The centers may look slightly underbaked.

9. **Cool**: Let cookies cool on the baking sheet for 2 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

## Tips for Perfect Cookies

- **Room temperature ingredients** mix better and create a smoother dough
- **Don't overbake** - cookies will continue cooking on the hot pan after removal
- **Chill the dough** for 30 minutes before baking for thicker cookies
- **Use parchment paper** for easy cleanup and even baking
- **Store in an airtight container** for up to 1 week

## Variations

- **Double Chocolate**: Replace ¬Ω cup flour with cocoa powder
- **Oatmeal Chocolate Chip**: Replace 1 cup flour with 1 cup rolled oats
- **White Chocolate Macadamia**: Use white chocolate chips and macadamia nuts
- **Sea Salt**: Sprinkle flaky sea salt on top before baking

Enjoy your homemade cookies with a glass of cold milk!

tools.name: create
tools.description: Creates a new markdown document and adds it to the space.

tools.name: open
tools.description: Opens and reads the contents of a new markdown document.

doc.description:
The ID of the referenced object. Formats accepted:
- DXN (dxn:echo:@:01KG7R1ZXWFMWQ4DA1Q6TN1DG4). DXNs can be prepended with an @ symbol for compatibility with in-text references.
- space ID, object ID tuple (spaceID:objectID)
- Only object ID that is assumed to be in the current space (01KG7R1ZXWFMWQ4DA1Q6TN1DG4)

tools.name: update
tools.description: Applies a set of edits to the markdown document.

doc.description:
The ID of the referenced object. Formats accepted:
- DXN (dxn:echo:@:01KG7R1ZXWFMWQ4DA1Q6TN1DG4). DXNs can be prepended with an @ symbol for compatibility with in-text references.
- space ID, object ID tuple (spaceID:objectID)
- Only object ID that is assumed to be in the current space (01KG7R1ZXWFMWQ4DA1Q6TN1DG4)

oldString.description: The text to find in the document.

newString.description: The text to replace it with.

replaceAll.description: If true, replaces all occurrences. Defaults to false (first occurrence only).

edits.description: The edits to apply to the document. Each edit finds oldString and replaces it with newString.

content.content:
## Blueprints Definitions

<blueprint>
  You can create, read and update markdown documents.
  When asked to edit or update documents return updates as a set of compact diff string pairs.
  For each diff, respond with the smallest possible matching span.
  
  Example:
  ```diff
  - "There is a tyop in this sentence."
  + "There is a typo in this sentence."
  - "This id good."
  + "This sentence is really good."
  ```
</blueprint>
Create a document with a cookie recipe.
